title: Understanding Left and Right Translations
text: For some value $$h$$, $$f(x-h)$$ means that f(x) is translated to the right by $$h$$ units. Similarly, $$f{\left(x+h\right)}$$ means that f(x) is translated to the left by $$h$$ units.
speech: For some value  h , , f of, parentheses x minus h,   means that f(x) is translated to the right by  h  units. Similarly, , f of, parentheses x plus h,   means that f(x) is translated to the left by  h  units.

,  , f of,  x minus h,

units. Similarly,  , f of,  x plus h,
means that f(x) is translated to the left by   h
units.

title: Understanding Left and Right Translations
text: A translation to the left by $$3$$ is represented by $$f{\left(x+3\right)}=\sqrt{x+3}$$
speech: A translation to the left by  3  is represented by , f of, parentheses x plus 3,  is equal to, the square root of x plus 3 end root

title: Understanding Up and Down Translations
text: For some value $$h$$, $$f{\left(x\right)}+h$$ means that f(x) is translated up by $$h$$ units. Similarly, $$f(x)-h$$ means that f(x) is translated down by $$h$$ units.
speech: For some value  h ,  f of x, plus, h  means that f(x) is translated up by  h  units. Similarly,  f of x minus h  means that f(x) is translated down by  h  units.

means that f(x) is translated down by   h
units.

title: Understanding Up and Down Translations
text: A translation up by $$4$$ is represented by $$f{\left(x+3\right)}+4=4+\sqrt{x+3}$$
speech: A translation up by  4  is represented by , f of, parentheses x plus 3,  plus 4 is equal to 4 plus, the square root of x plus 3 end root

is represented by  , f of,  x plus 3,  plus 4 is equal to 4 plus, the square root of x plus 3 end root

title: Understanding Reflections
text: $$f(-x)$$ means that f(x) is reflected across the y-axis. Similarly, $$-f(x)$$ means that f(x) is reflected across the x-axis.
speech: , f of negative x,  means that f(x) is reflected across the y-axis. Similarly,  negative f of x  means that f(x) is reflected across the x-axis.
pacedSpeech: , f of negative x,
means that f(x) is reflected across the y-axis. Similarly,   negative f of x
means that f(x) is reflected across the x-axis.

title: Understanding Reflections
text: A reflection over the y-axis is represented by $$f\left(-x+3\right)+4=4+\sqrt{-x+3}$$
speech: A reflection over the y-axis is represented by  f of, parentheses, negative x plus 3,  plus 4 is equal to 4 plus, the square root of negative x plus 3 end root
